key_contexts: Multinational defence cooperation and alliance-based force development
Strategic competition and supply-chain resilience concerns
Industrial policy linked to defence capability and readiness
key_mechanisms: Industrial participation used to strengthen domestic and allied supply chains
Capability co-development to improve interoperability and delivery speed
Policy alignment as a coordination mechanism among partners
key_outcomes: Improved readiness through coordinated industrial planning
Potential trade-offs between national industrial goals and collective efficiency
noted_risks_or_mitigations: Risk of fragmentation if industrial priorities diverge
Mitigation via common standards and joint programme governance
